tweets.html:
The Jinx has been a bad influence & I would appreciate if some1 would check my HBO parental control the next time a murderer miniseries airs

— i, a cancer (@mostlyemotional) March 24, 2015

I could say all the usual superlatives about this week's THE AMERICANS, but suffice it to say that Mail Robot is rightfully prominent.

— James Poniewozik (@poniewozik) March 24, 2015

Also, if you are not watching The Americans: THIS SHOW HAS A FREAKING MAIL ROBOT. What more do you want from a TV show???

— James Poniewozik (@poniewozik) March 24, 2015

I mean, if a Mail Robot is not enough to sign yourself up for at least 1 season, just throw out your TV, you have disgraced it #TheAmericans

— James Poniewozik (@poniewozik) March 24, 2015

does HBO know that with every day they hold out on this Looking renewal they weaken my already tenuous will to live or no

— i, a cancer (@mostlyemotional) March 24, 2015

If you're going to name a show 12 Monkeys and not have it be all about monkeys I don't understand the point.

— Danielle Nussbaum (@daniellenuss) March 24, 2015

Damn you, #BreakingBad. Why won't you let me believe that #BetterCallSaul is the story of a crusading elder law attorney??

— Poe Daar-meron (@AndrewDaar) March 25, 2015

Congrats to @Deadline for their article I Just Have A Bad Feeling About Those Two New Black Families In Town. http://t.co/D8K1WAIIub

— Louis Virtel (@louisvirtel) March 25, 2015

Tomorrow on Deadline Hollywood: "Enough Funny Jews, Already!"

— Dave Itzkoff (@ditzkoff) March 25, 2015

So many people signed off on that use on the word "ethnic"......

— Kayla Kumari Upadhyaya (@KaylaKumari) March 25, 2015

#Sharknado 4: #EthnicCasting

— Kel "Jingle Jangle Bells" K. (@TVKel) March 25, 2015

Shorter version of that awful Deadline story: Hey, people of color, you got a few shows! Now step off, you're making some agents nervous.

— Mo Ryan (@moryan) March 25, 2015

I love how this story about too many "ethnic castings" WAS POSTED with the tag "controversial." http://t.co/8GNVypA14e

— Todd VanDerWerff (@tvoti) March 25, 2015

@damianholbrook @tvoti they forgot the tag "stupid"

— Mo Ryan (@moryan) March 25, 2015

@damianholbrook @moryan @tvoti No "racist parrot" tag?

— Kate Aurthur (@KateAurthur) March 25, 2015

We got 1 season where TV isn't lily white and people are already whining about poor white actors losing out on roles b/c of "ethnic quotas"

— Awesomely Luvvie (@Luvvie) March 25, 2015

.@Luvvie Shorter @DeadlineNellie: "You people have six whole shows now. That's enough."

— veronica be painting (@veronicamarche) March 25, 2015

everybody calm down, we all know the deadline piece was just the beginning of the #EntourageMovie viral marketing campaign

— robert kessler (@thebobkessler) March 25, 2015

Pretty sure I just read a trade article about how there is too much diversity on TV.

— Evan Dickson (@EvanDickson) March 25, 2015

ICYMI: @Deadline thinks racial diversity in casting is good so long as it doesn't upset "the natural order of things"

— DJ Summitt (@djsummitt) March 25, 2015

I wanna watch ‚ÄúFresh Off the Boat,‚Äù but thanks to Deadline I can only think of the poor white actors denied the chance to be Huangs.

— Daniel Fienberg (@TheFienPrint) March 25, 2015

@Eric_Haywood @jaugustrichards Guys, come on. Some of @deadline's best friends are #ethnics

— DJ Summitt (@djsummitt) March 25, 2015

"There was a noticeable shift toward ethnic castings last season" is 2015's "People often ask me how to make conversation at dinner parties"

— mr. gold at the gaslight (@migold) March 25, 2015

Who Will Think Of The White People In Hollywood, MY GOD, WHO??? A Five Part Series

— Mo Ryan (@moryan) March 25, 2015

I think I know how to solve TV's sudden lack of roles for white actors

BRING

BACK

RUBICON

— David Sims (@davidlsims) March 25, 2015

@DeadlineNellie Your mentions. RIP. pic.twitter.com/BuC38sgOeB

— well... actually (@HavanaBrown508) March 25, 2015

@KwanaWrites @AlishaRai @FarrahRochon @DeadlineNellie The tv has more than 1 token dark friend on every 15th show? I want my country back!

— Robin Bradfordüç∏ üéâüéÑü§∂üèæüéÖüèæ (@Tuphlos) March 25, 2015

What Color is This Casting? - A new Buzzfeed clickbait being written right now. #EthnicCasting

— Kel "Jingle Jangle Bells" K. (@TVKel) March 25, 2015

MY BOY VINNIE CHASE COULDN'T GET CAST IN THE NEW BILLY WALSH PILOT BECAUSE HE'S WHITE. TURTLE'S MAD AT SAIGON. DRAMA FUCKED A FAT CHICK.

— robert kessler (@thebobkessler) March 25, 2015

@ditzkoff Think of all the white actors who could have played Terrence Howard's sons in Empire. It's so unfair.

— Mark Harris (@MarkHarrisNYC) March 25, 2015

@DeadlineNellie So lemme get this straight. You woke up this morning INTENDING to offend as many black folks as possible? #girlhaveaseat

— Michele Val Jean (@MicheleValJean) March 25, 2015

FUCK NO WE DONT WANT ANY PEOPLE OF COLOR CAST IN MY BOY EDDIE BURNS FIVE TOWNS COMING TO NBC THIS FALL BUT DAN COKLEY HAS JUNGLE FEVER

— robert kessler (@thebobkessler) March 25, 2015

In Deadline's defense, "Ethnic Castings" was a pretty unfortunate Outdoor Life Network show.

— Scott Tobias (@scott_tobias) March 25, 2015

If you choose to ignore the kinds of attitudes you‚Äôre up against, then you deserve what you get.

— Eric Haywood (@EricHaywood) March 25, 2015

And if you think @Deadline‚Äôs attitude is some kind of aberration, I don‚Äôt even know what to tell you.

— Eric Haywood (@EricHaywood) March 25, 2015

I have "ethnic" actor friends who got stuck for yrs in stereotypical guest star roles. But how dare they get a shot at leads, huh @Deadline?

— Edana (@RedSaid) March 25, 2015

What troubles me is the decision-makers in Hollywood who will read that @Deadline tripe about black actors in television and say, "Exactly."

— Jamil Smith (@JamilSmith) March 25, 2015

I hate that everything that includes forward movement of Black people is considered a trend, dismissing it as some temporary phenomenon.

— Awesomely Luvvie (@Luvvie) March 25, 2015

That @deadline piece was‚Ä¶ wow. Stunned at how many people must have needed to okay that unambiguously racist bullshit.

— @red3blog (@red3blog) March 25, 2015

Horrible Deadline article, you've left me no choice. I must go FULL FACEPALM, from ALL of Star Trek! Happy now??! pic.twitter.com/HC3FEY5CTW

— Mo Ryan (@moryan) March 25, 2015

1st Reaction:: HELL NO. Lemme take off my earrings, somebody hold my purse!
2nd Reaction: Article is so ignorant I can't even be bothered.

— shonda rhimes (@shondarhimes) March 25, 2015

Whenever white people are not on screen, all the other characters should be asking "Where's the white people?"

— LaToya Ferguson (@lafergs) March 25, 2015

Did the Deadline article say anything about whether or not Chappie was black?

— billy eichner (@billyeichner) March 25, 2015

Maybe we can have Starbucks baristas speak with Deadline

— Enrique Rea (@HankRea) March 25, 2015

Breaking News: @DeadlineNellie has started a Kickstarter so Corey Feldman can land a role on Empire. #diversity

— Enrique Rea (@HankRea) March 25, 2015

.@DeadlineNellie Are you saying you wish to see "ethnics" cleansed from your television?

— Poe Daar-meron (@AndrewDaar) March 25, 2015

Guys, it's great to see so many diverse reactions to @Deadline's idiocy, but maybe we take a step back here: are they TOO diverse?

— Nate Winslow (@nate_winslow) March 25, 2015

It's about ethnics in entertainment journalism.

— James Urbaniak (@JamesUrbaniak) March 25, 2015

I am SO sorry that TV is finally reflecting the diverse America we live in. Gosh, @DeadlineNellie, thanks for outlining the white struggle.

— Suleikha Snyder (@suleikhasnyder) March 25, 2015

Ahem My book, The Primetime Politics of Colorblind Casting in Primetime TV will be out in June. That'll explain this. http://t.co/6vxJ6CYMTs

— Irascibly Ornery Dr. KW (@kristenwarner) March 25, 2015

Sadly, my book will be hardback only for awhile and stupidly costly. BUT: if need be I will rip out chapters and post them online so that+

— Irascibly Ornery Dr. KW (@kristenwarner) March 25, 2015

we can actually have NUANCED conversations cause you know what, Nellie was reporting what the backslap and great fear of physically racial

— Irascibly Ornery Dr. KW (@kristenwarner) March 25, 2015

diversity at the level of studio and guild has always been trying to navigate. Do you know how much balance those diversity reps have to do

— Irascibly Ornery Dr. KW (@kristenwarner) March 25, 2015

to make sure white able bodied male actors don't feel left out? It's a lot. A lot a lot. So we'll talk about that a little.

— Irascibly Ornery Dr. KW (@kristenwarner) March 25, 2015

(That's the most I've ever said about my project. And it never ceases to be surreal or feel quite odd.)

— Irascibly Ornery Dr. KW (@kristenwarner) March 25, 2015

Here's what the Deadline story is saying and not saying: 1) As part of the 20 year cycle of the shame and success of physical diversity+

— Irascibly Ornery Dr. KW (@kristenwarner) March 25, 2015

as well as the success of key series (and some network turnover which will always beget radical programming shifts) networks are tasking

— Irascibly Ornery Dr. KW (@kristenwarner) March 25, 2015

casting directors to open their books wider & scope out diverse looking talent. In large droves. And plug that talent in every vacant hole.

— Irascibly Ornery Dr. KW (@kristenwarner) March 25, 2015

2) Of course, that means the tried and true argument of "best" talent will emerge bc clearly, in plugging these holes, some white actors

— Irascibly Ornery Dr. KW (@kristenwarner) March 25, 2015

will likely be left out this season lineup (altho they trad'lly make up 78% of all guild roles). But remember 3) these shows ain't gon all

— Irascibly Ornery Dr. KW (@kristenwarner) March 25, 2015

will likely be left out this season lineup (altho they trad'lly make up 78% of all guild roles). But remember 3) these shows ain't gon all

— Irascibly Ornery Dr. KW (@kristenwarner) March 25, 2015

survive and so as much of a Black planet as is being described it will be FAR more tame. What's more, those that do get ordered to series+

— Irascibly Ornery Dr. KW (@kristenwarner) March 25, 2015

will likely not survive (as is the case for most new series, right?) bc wrong times, wrong fits, lack of RESONANCE (bc Black bodies don't+

— Irascibly Ornery Dr. KW (@kristenwarner) March 25, 2015

equal correlative feelings of connection and affect and the identification is often only skin deep), and you know, FATE. What's more?

— Irascibly Ornery Dr. KW (@kristenwarner) March 25, 2015

You still gotta have these characters of color convince mainstream white audiences that they're "just like them" and that's hard to do.

— Irascibly Ornery Dr. KW (@kristenwarner) March 25, 2015

So‚Ä¶you're gonna have a lot of bombs come Fall 2015. And (Oh! I forgot this part!) The guilds aren't gonna stand against their membership.

— Irascibly Ornery Dr. KW (@kristenwarner) March 25, 2015

which is actually the juiciest part bc for so long it was men and women of color fighting to get the guild to say some ish was wrong

— Irascibly Ornery Dr. KW (@kristenwarner) March 25, 2015

:cough: Tropic Thunder :cough: and the guild said, we don't stand against ourselves so that was that. So it's gonna be funny to watch

— Irascibly Ornery Dr. KW (@kristenwarner) March 25, 2015

@kristenwarner majority membership quietly (or not so quietly) complain about the reverse. And listen: it's NOT just racial/ethnic diversity

— Irascibly Ornery Dr. KW (@kristenwarner) March 25, 2015

that get complained about. People with disabilities? Whooo. Listen. The stories!

I digress.

— Irascibly Ornery Dr. KW (@kristenwarner) March 25, 2015

Back to the point. The shows will likely largely fail and when they do, the Deadline piece is previewing for us all why the reaction will

— Irascibly Ornery Dr. KW (@kristenwarner) March 25, 2015

flip so firmly BACK into normative status quo. "It was too much too soon. We tried to meet the demands of a diverse public and they

— Irascibly Ornery Dr. KW (@kristenwarner) March 25, 2015

told us that they weren't ready for it in quite this way so we need to repeal some of these earmarks." OR once the new network overlords

— Irascibly Ornery Dr. KW (@kristenwarner) March 25, 2015

get comfortable with where they are and get to a spot where they can reboot with the tried, true, and always imagined [white] mainstream aud

— Irascibly Ornery Dr. KW (@kristenwarner) March 25, 2015

they will "Fox Formula" on these shows faster than they appeared. So 4) The article is awful and shows a working example of H'wood logic BUT

— Irascibly Ornery Dr. KW (@kristenwarner) March 25, 2015

5) this game gets played essentially the SAME way every two decades or so and there's rarely lasting change bc 6) ACTORS of color need to be

— Irascibly Ornery Dr. KW (@kristenwarner) March 25, 2015

supported by WRITERS of color and DIRECTORS of color and PRODUCERS of color and NETWORK EXECS of color and CASTING DIRECTORS of color.

— Irascibly Ornery Dr. KW (@kristenwarner) March 25, 2015

You put a bunch of Black and Brown bodies on a screen and ask an audience of Black and Brown (and yes, white ppl too) to watch them simply

— Irascibly Ornery Dr. KW (@kristenwarner) March 25, 2015

cause they look like you? That's gon' fail. Nellie cites Undercovers which cast two (blind cast) Black leads and that show FAILED.

— Irascibly Ornery Dr. KW (@kristenwarner) March 25, 2015

Why? Cuz it wasn't great? Sure. But also bc they were blind cast and doing things that just didn't resonate. So‚Ä¶it went the way of the dodo.

— Irascibly Ornery Dr. KW (@kristenwarner) March 25, 2015

So, let's joyously celebrate the diversity of pilot season! But I'm also saying, we've sorta been here before. We'll likely be here again.

— Irascibly Ornery Dr. KW (@kristenwarner) March 25, 2015

Be upset with the Deadline piece but realize and recognize that that will be the logic used to bring us back around. Let's not get smug.

— Irascibly Ornery Dr. KW (@kristenwarner) March 25, 2015

Because actors getting employment is great but that is but ONE puzzle piece of a very large set of problems that we're not dealing w cuz

— Irascibly Ornery Dr. KW (@kristenwarner) March 25, 2015

we wanna smugly say we're better than that because of THAT show and THAT show and THAT other show.

Questions? Comments? #end

— Irascibly Ornery Dr. KW (@kristenwarner) March 25, 2015

Further reading References: Herman Gray's Watching Race; Cultural Moves, Kristal Brent Zook's Color By Fox, all of Bogle's books.

— Irascibly Ornery Dr. KW (@kristenwarner) March 25, 2015

Okay Ima log off and go to bed because we've entered the space of outrage without context and‚Ä¶I got a 7 am flight. Y'all have fun now.

— Irascibly Ornery Dr. KW (@kristenwarner) March 25, 2015
